_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:43 using v2.7
title: How has the number of community nurses changed?
analysis_commentary:
Despite the increase in the overall numbers of qualified nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff, this has not be a pattern uniformly seen across all types of nurse groups and the main driver for the underlying fluctuations and overall numbers are nurses in Acute, Elderly & General settings (data not shown).

The number of community nurses fell from 48,108 in September 2009 to 45,272 in August 2013, a 5.9% decrease. Since then there has been a recovery but leaves the total number of FTEs little unchanged since the start of the data collection in September 2009, with 48,185 community full time equivalent nurses employed in May 2015
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
